ludcmp.c

00001 #include "math.h"
00002 #include "utility.h"
00003 #include "utility_macros.h"
00004 
00005 #define TINY 1.0e-20;
00006 
00007 #define  CALC_NO_DET   0
00008 #define  CALC_DET      1
00009 #define  CALC_DET_ONLY 2
00010 
00011 extern int my_lubksb();
00012 
00013 int my_ludcmp(double **a, int n, int *indx,double *d)
00014      
00015 {
00016   int i,imax=0,j,k;
00017   double big,dum,sum,temp;
00018   double *vv;
00019   
00020   
00021   vv=my_vector(1,n);
00022   *d=1.0;
00023   for (i=1;i<=n;i++) {
00024     big=0.0;
00025     for (j=1;j<=n;j++)
00026       if ((temp=fabs(a[i][j])) > big) big=temp;
00027     if (big == 0.0) {
00028       printf("Singular matrix in routine LUDCMP\n");
00029       return 0;
00030     }
00031     vv[i]=1.0/big;
00032   }
00033   for (j=1;j<=n;j++) {
00034     for (i=1;i<j;i++) {
00035       sum=a[i][j];
00036       for (k=1;k<i;k++) sum -= a[i][k]*a[k][j];
00037       a[i][j]=sum;
00038     }
00039     big=0.0;
00040     for (i=j;i<=n;i++) {
00041       sum=a[i][j];
00042       for (k=1;k<j;k++)
00043         sum -= a[i][k]*a[k][j];
00044       a[i][j]=sum;
00045       if ( (dum=vv[i]*fabs(sum)) >= big) {
00046         big=dum;
00047         imax=i;
00048       }
00049     }
00050     if (j != imax) {
00051       for (k=1;k<=n;k++) {
00052         dum=a[imax][k];
00053         a[imax][k]=a[j][k];
00054         a[j][k]=dum;
00055       }
00056       *d = -(*d);
00057       vv[imax]=vv[j];
00058     }
00059     indx[j]=imax;
00060     if (a[j][j] == 0.0) a[j][j]=TINY;
00061     if (j != n) {
00062       dum=1.0/(a[j][j]);
00063       for (i=j+1;i<=n;i++) a[i][j] *= dum;
00064     }
00065   }
00066   my_free_vector(vv,1,n);
00067   return 1;
00068 }
00069 
00070 #undef TINY
00071 
00072 /*!*****************************************************************************
00073  *******************************************************************************
00074  \note  my_inv_ludcmp_gen
00075  \date  Nov 2008 (Modified by Mrinal)
00076  
00077  \remarks 
00078  
00079  uses the LUDCMP to invert a square matrix.
00080  Also calculates the determinant if needed
00081  
00082  *******************************************************************************
00083  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
00084  
00085  \param[in]     mat        : matrix to be inverted
00086  \param[in]     size       : mat is a size x size matrix
00087  \param[out]    inv_mat    : inverse of this matrix
00088  \param[in]     calculate_determinant : one of CALC_NO_DET, CALC_DET, CALC_DET_ONLY
00089  \param[out]    det        : determinant of the matrix (if requested)
00090  
00091  note: - return code FALSE is given if not invertable
00092  - mat and inv_mat can be the same matrices; the program takes
00093  care of this
00094  - matrices are according to numerical recipes convention
00095  
00096  
00097  ******************************************************************************/
00098 int 
00099 my_inv_ludcmp_gen(double **mat, int size, double **inv_mat, int calculate_determinant, double* det)
00100 
00101 {
00102   
00103   int             i,j,n;
00104   int             rc = 1;
00105   double          info;
00106   MY_MATRIX(aux, 1, size, 1, size);
00107   MY_IVECTOR(indx, 1, size);
00108   
00109   for (i=1; i<=size; ++i) for (j=1; j<=size; ++j) aux[i][j]=mat[i][j];
00110   
00111   if (!my_ludcmp(aux,size,indx,&info)) {
00112     
00113     rc = 0;
00114     
00115   } else {
00116 
00117     if (calculate_determinant != CALC_DET_ONLY) {
00118       
00119       /* make zuu_inv the identity matrix */
00120       
00121       for (i=1; i<=size; ++i) {
00122         for (j=1; j<=size; ++j) {
00123           inv_mat[i][j] = 0.0;
00124           if (i==j) inv_mat[i][j] = 1.0;
00125         }
00126       }
00127       
00128       /* now generate the inverse. Due to the setup of matrices, I will
00129          actuall create the transpose of the inverse */
00130       
00131       for (i=1; i<=size; ++i) {
00132         my_lubksb(aux, size, indx, inv_mat[i]);
00133       }
00134       
00135       /* now take the transpose of this inverse to make it what I want */
00136       
00137       mat_trans(inv_mat, inv_mat);
00138 
00139     }
00140 
00141     if (calculate_determinant && det!=NULL) {
00142       
00143       calculate_determinant = CALC_NO_DET;
00144 
00145       *det = info;
00146 
00147       for (i=1; i<=size; ++i) *det *= aux[i][i];
00148 
00149     }
00150     
00151   }
00152   
00153   return rc;
00154 }

00157 /*!*****************************************************************************
00158  *******************************************************************************
00159  \note  my_inv_ludcmp
00160  \date  March 93
00161  
00162  \remarks 
00163  
00164  uses the LUDCMP to invert a square matrix
00165  
00166  *******************************************************************************
00167  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
00168  
00169  \param[in]     mat        : matrix to be inverted
00170  \param[in]     size       : mat is a size x size matrix
00171  \param[out]    inv_mat    : inverse of this matrix
00172  
00173  note: - return code FALSE is given if not invertable
00174  - mat and inv_mat can be the same matrices; the program takes
00175  care of this
00176  - matrices are according to numerical recipes convention
00177  
00178  
00179  ******************************************************************************/
00180 int 
00181 my_inv_ludcmp(double **mat, int size, double **inv_mat)
00182 
00183 {
00184   return my_inv_ludcmp_gen(mat, size, inv_mat, CALC_NO_DET, NULL);
00185 }

00187 /*!*****************************************************************************
00188  *******************************************************************************
00189  \note  my_inv_ludcmp_solve
00190  \date  March 93
00191  
00192  \remarks 
00193  
00194  uses the LUDCMP to invert a square matrix and solve it for a given vector
00195  
00196              A x = b
00197 
00198  *******************************************************************************
00199  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
00200  
00201  \param[in]     mat        : matrix to be inverted
00202  \param[in]     b_vec      : vector for which system is to be solved
00203  \param[in]     size       : mat is a size x size matrix
00204  \param[out]    x_vec      : the result
00205  
00206  note: - return code FALSE is given if not invertable
00207  - mat and inv_mat can be the same matrices; the program takes
00208  care of this
00209  - matrices are according to numerical recipes convention
00210  
00211  
00212  ******************************************************************************/
00213 int 
00214 my_inv_ludcmp_solve(double **mat, double *b_vec, int size, double *x_vec)
00215 
00216 {
00217   
00218   int             i,j,n;
00219   int             rc = 1;
00220   double          info;
00221   MY_MATRIX(aux, 1, size, 1, size);
00222   MY_IVECTOR(indx, 1, size);
00223   
00224   for (i=1; i<=size; ++i) for (j=1; j<=size; ++j) aux[i][j]=mat[i][j];
00225   
00226   if (!my_ludcmp(aux,size,indx,&info)) {
00227     
00228     rc = 0;
00229     
00230   } else {
00231     
00232     /* make zuu_inv the identity matrix */
00233     
00234     for (i=1; i<=size; ++i) {
00235       x_vec[i] = b_vec[i];
00236     }
00237     
00238     /* now generate the solution */
00239     
00240     my_lubksb(aux, size, indx, x_vec);
00241     
00242   }
00243   
00244   return rc;
00245 }

00247 /*!*****************************************************************************
00248  *******************************************************************************
00249  \note  my_inv_ludcmp_solve_many
00250  \date  March 93
00251  
00252  \remarks 
00253  
00254  uses the LUDCMP to invert a square matrix and solve it for a set of
00255  given vectors
00256  
00257              A x1 = b1   A x2 = b2 ....
00258 
00259  *******************************************************************************
00260  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
00261  
00262  \param[in]     mat        : matrix to be inverted
00263  \param[in]     b_vec      : matrix of vectors for which system is to be solved
00264                  NOTE: each ROW is used as a vector!!
00265  \param[in]     size       : mat is a size x size matrix
00266  \param[in]     n_vec      : how many vectors are to be solved for
00267  \param[out]    x_vec      : result matrix the result
00268                  NOTE: each ROW is used as a output vector!!
00269  
00270  note: - return code FALSE is given if not invertable
00271  - mat and inv_mat can be the same matrices; the program takes
00272  care of this
00273  - matrices are according to numerical recipes convention
00274  
00275  
00276  ******************************************************************************/
00277 int 
00278 my_inv_ludcmp_solve_many(double **mat, double **b_vec, int size, int n_vec,
00279                          double **x_vec)
00280 
00281 {
00282   
00283   int             i,j,n;
00284   int             rc = 1;
00285   double          info;
00286   MY_MATRIX(aux, 1, size, 1, size);
00287   MY_IVECTOR(indx, 1, size);
00288   
00289   for (i=1; i<=size; ++i) for (j=1; j<=size; ++j) aux[i][j]=mat[i][j];
00290   
00291   if (!my_ludcmp(aux,size,indx,&info)) {
00292     
00293     rc = 0;
00294     
00295   } else {
00296     
00297     /* make zuu_inv the identity matrix */
00298 
00299     for (j=1; j<=n_vec; ++j) {
00300     
00301       for (i=1; i<=size; ++i) {
00302         x_vec[j][i] = b_vec[j][i];
00303       }
00304       
00305       /* now generate the solution */
00306       
00307       my_lubksb(aux, size, indx, x_vec[j]);
00308 
00309     }
00310     
00311   }
00312   
00313   return rc;
00314 }

00316 /*!*****************************************************************************
00317  *******************************************************************************
00318  \note  my_inv_ludcmp_det
00319  \date  March 93
00320  
00321  \remarks 
00322  
00323  uses the LUDCMP to invert a square matrix and calculates also the
00324  determinant
00325  
00326  *******************************************************************************
00327  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
00328  
00329  \param[in]     mat        : matrix to be inverted
00330  \param[in]     size       : mat is a size x size matrix
00331  \param[out]    inv_mat    : inverse of this matrix
00332  \param[out]    deter      : the determinant
00333 
00334  note: - return code FALSE is given if not invertable
00335        - mat and inv_mat can be the same matrices; the program takes
00336          care of this
00337        - matrices are according to numerical recipes convention
00338  
00339  
00340  ******************************************************************************/
00341 int 
00342 my_inv_ludcmp_det(double **mat, int size, double **inv_mat, double *deter)
00343 
00344 {
00345   int rc,i;
00346 
00347   rc = my_inv_ludcmp_gen(mat, size, inv_mat, CALC_DET, deter);
00348 
00349   return rc;
00350 
00351 }

00354  *******************************************************************************
00355  \note  my_ludcmp_det
00356  \date  March 93
00357  
00358  \remarks 
00359  
00360  uses the LUDCMP to calculate the  determinant of the given matrix
00361  
00362  *******************************************************************************
00363  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
00364  
00365  \param[in]     mat        : matrix 
00366  \param[in]     size       : mat is a size x size matrix
00367  \param[out]    deter      : the determinant
00368 
00369  note: - return code FALSE is given if not invertable
00370        - matrices are according to numerical recipes convention
00371  
00372  ******************************************************************************/
00373 int 
00374 my_ludcmp_det(double **mat, int size, double *deter)
00375 
00376 {
00377   int rc,i;
00378   MY_MATRIX(aux, 1, size, 1, size);
00379   
00380   rc = my_inv_ludcmp_gen(mat, size, aux, CALC_DET_ONLY, deter);
00381 
00382   return rc;
00383 
00384 }
